Description: HUMAN PAPILLOMAVIRUS (HPV) ROUNDTABLE: SUPPORTING A NATIONAL NETWORK OF PARTNERS TO PROMOTE CANCER PREVENTION THROUGH HUMAN PAPILLOMAVIRUS VACCINATION - THE NATIONAL HPV VACCINATION ROUNDTABLE (?HPV ROUNDTABLE?), FOUNDED IN 2014, SERVES AS THE PRE-EMINENT ORGANIZATION TO COMMUNICATE, CONVENE AND CATALYZE NATIONAL, REGIONAL AND STATE STAKEHOLDERS AROUND THE COMMON MISSION OF RAISING HPV VACCINATION RATES AND PREVENTING HPV-RELATED CANCERS.  OVER 70 MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS COLLABORATE UNDER THE LEADERSHIP OF THE AMERICAN CANCER SOCIETY AND THE CDC TO ADVANCE HPV VACCINATION. THE HPV ROUNDTABLE AND ITS MEMBERS HAVE EFFECTIVELY RAISED AWARENESS AND BUILT MOMENTUM AROUND HPV CANCER PREVENTION. OVER THE LAST SEVEN YEARS WE HAVE DRIVEN NATIONAL CONVERSATIONS AND CATALYZED ACTION THROUGH CONVENING AND GALVANIZING STAKEHOLDERS, CREATING INNOVATIVE SOLUTIONS, AND DISSEMINATING EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTIONS AND PROMISING PRACTICES. IN THE COMING 5 YEARS, OR HPV ROUNDTABLE 2.0, COALITION EFFORTS WILL ACTIVELY ENGAGE KEY EXTERNAL AUDIENCES FOR MAXIMUM IMPACT.  THE WORK HAS EVOLVED FROM INFLUENCING PROVIDERS AND PARENTS TO INFLUENCING HEALTH SYSTEMS, THEIR LEADERSHIP, AND THE HEALTH PLANS THAT INFLUENCE ADOLESCENT VACCINATION MEASURES.2020 PUT A SPOTLIGHT ON RACIAL INJUSTICES AND THE HPV ROUNDTABLE MADE A COMMITMENT TO BETTER ADDRESS HEALTH EQUITY AND INCLUSION IN OUR WORK. WE ARE WORKING TO BETTER REFLECT THE DIVERSITY OF ALL AMERICANS IN OUR MEMBERSHIP AND TO CLOSE CANCER DISPARITY GAPS THROUGH VACCINATING EVERY ADOLESCENT CHILD ON TIME.THE THREE PRIMARY STRATEGIES FOR HPV ROUNDTABLE 2.0 REPRESENT SMART BUT STRATEGIC GROWTH BUILT UP FROM THE EXISTING PLATFORM: (1) MAINTAIN, EXPAND, AND STRENGTHEN THE NETWORK OF KEY STAKEHOLDERS, WITH A FOCUS ON EQUITY AND ON STRATEGIC COMMUNICATIONS THROUGH MULTIPLE CHANNELS, (2) CONVENE MEMBERS AND CATALYZE ACTION IN THEIR ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE HPV VACCINATION THROUGH BEST AND PROMISING PRACTICES, AND (3) ADDRESS PRIORITY ISSUES AND ACTIVITIES THROUGH TASK GROUPS, FORUMS, COMMITTEES, TOOLS AND RESOURCES.ACS IS UNIQUELY POSITIONED TO CONTINUE SERVING AS CONVENER OF THE HPV ROUNDTABLE. OUR ORGANIZATION HAS A STRONG HISTORY OF BRINGING COLLABORATIVE PARTNERS TOGETHER FOR CANCER PREVENTION, APPLYING EVIDENCE-BASED STRATEGIES AND RESOURCES, AND DISSEMINATING AND PROMOTING MESSAGES, TOOLS, AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDERS AND TO THE PUBLIC, INCLUDING HARD-TO-REACH AND UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS. ACS HAS BEEN A LEADER IN HPV CANCER PREVENTION AND IN MANAGING NATIONAL ROUNDTABLES. THE HPV ROUNDTABLE STAFF TEAM HAS PROVIDED THE LEADERSHIP, STRATEGIES, AND DAY-TO-DAY MANAGEMENT OF THE ROUNDTABLE AND ITS ACTIVITIES FOR THE PAST SEVEN YEARS. THE NEXT FIVE YEARS WILL BUILD ON A FOUNDATION OF TRUST AMONG HPV ROUNDTABLE MEMBERS AND ACS?S PROVEN INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY.
IMMUNIZATION BARRIERS IN THE UNITED STATES: TARGETING MEDICAID PARTNERSHIPS
IMMUNIZATION BARRIERS IN THE UNITED STATES TARGETING MEDICAID PARTNERSHIPS -- ELIMINATING BARRIERS TO IMMUNIZATION THROUGH STATE INTERAGENCY AND COMMUNITY COLLABORATION

PROMOTING, STRENGTHENING AND ENHANCING DISEASE PREVENTION BY COLLABORATION WITH TARGETED PARTNERSHIPS - VACCINATE YOUR FAMILY (VYF) SEEKS TO CONTINUE ITS 30-YEAR HISTORY OF INCREASING VACCINE CONFIDENCE, DEMAND, AND EQUITY THROUGH TRAINING, EDUCATION AND ONGOING COLLABORATIONS WITH PARTNERS, TRUSTED MESSENGERS, VACCINE ADVOCATES, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS (CBOS), AND SPECIAL SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION PROGRAM FOR WOMEN, INFANTS, AND CHILDREN (WIC) STAFF. VYF IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING CULTURALLY RELEVANT AND ACCESSIBLE INFORMATION AND RESOURCES TO EVERYONE, ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO HAVE BEEN HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED, MARGINALIZED, AND ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY PERSISTENT INEQUALITIES. THIS FUNDING WOULD ALLOW VYF TO CONDUCT COMMUNICATION, EDUCATION, AND QUALITY IMPROVEMENT ACTIVITIES TO PROMOTE AND MAINTAIN ACCURATE INFORMATION ABOUT VACCINES AMONG PARTNERS AND THE PUBLIC VIA THE VYF-LED VACCINATION COLLABORATIVE, ONLINE COMMUNICATION CHANNELS, MESSAGING TOOLKITS, AND KNOWLEDGE-SHARING WITH PARTNERS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC. IT WOULD ALSO ALLOW VYF TO CONTINUE ITS LONG-STANDING PARTNERSHIP WITH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND RESOURCES TO WIC STAFF AND THE CLIENTS THEY SERVE. LASTLY, THE FUNDING OPPORTUNITY WOULD SUPPORT VYF’S EFFORTS TO CONNECT, TRAIN, AND ENGAGE TRUSTED MESSENGERS, INCLUDING PROMOTORES DE SALUD, COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKERS, AND ADVOCATES AFFECTED BY VACCINE-PREVENTABLE DISEASES. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL IMPROVE THE AVAILABILITY AND USE OF ACCURATE VACCINE INFORMATION AS WELL AS BOLSTER VACCINE CONFIDENCE, ESPECIALLY IN COMMUNITIES WITH LOW VACCINE UPTAKE AND WHO HAVE BEEN HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED AND UNDERSERVED. THEY WILL ALSO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE, EVIDENCE-BASED QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS, REFERRALS TO VACCINATION PROVIDERS, AND OPPORTUNITIES TO PROMOTE BEST PRACTICES BY AND AMONG PARTNERS, INCLUDING WIC STAFF.

DEVELOPING AND DISSEMINATING TARGETED IMMUNIZATION MATERIALS - BACKGROUND: AS THE GLOBAL COVID-19 VACCINATION PROGRAM UNFOLDS TO COMBAT THE PANDEMIC THAT BEGAN IN 2020, WE ARE REMINDED AGAIN THAT VACCINATION IS ONE OF OUR MOST IMPORTANT LIFE-SUSTAINING MEDICAL ACHIEVEMENTS. NONETHELESS, THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS UNDERMINED HARD WON GAINS IN ROUTINE VACCINATION COVERAGE ACROSS ALL AGE GROUPS, LEAVING LARGE NUMBERS OF PEOPLE OF ALL AGES OVERDUE FOR RECOMMENDED VACCINES. AS A RESULT, THERE IS A STRONG NEED FOR EFFECTIVE COALITIONS TO CHAMPION IMMUNIZATIONS AND ADDRESS DISPARITIES IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, AS WELL AS FOR SOURCES OF CREDIBLE SCIENTIFIC IMMUNIZATION INFORMATION THAT HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS CAN USE TO COMMUNICATE WITH PATIENTS SEEKING TO UNDERSTAND THE EFFECTIVENESS AND SAFETY OF VACCINES ACROSS THE LIFE SPAN. THE SWIFT INTRODUCTION OF COVID-19 VACCINES UNDER EMERGENCY USE AUTHORIZATION (EUA) ALSO HAS INTENSIFIED THE DEMAND FOR RAPID COMMUNICATION OF NEW AND URGENT VACCINE-RELATED COMMUNICATIONS TO FRONT LINE IMMUNIZERS.OBJECTIVES: IN THIS APPLICATION TO THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR IMMUNIZATION AND RESPIRATORY DISEASES AT THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC), THE IMMUNIZATION ACTION COALITION (IAC) SEEKS TO COMPLEMENT AND AMPLIFY CDC?S EFFORTS TO INCREASE IMMUNIZATION RATES AND REDUCE DISPARITIES BY DEVELOPING AND DISSEMINATING EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS ON CURRENT IMMUNIZATION RECOMMENDATIONS AND PRACTICES FOR PROVIDERS TO SHARE WITH PATIENTS, PARENTS, AND THE PUBLIC; TRANSLATING VACCINE INFORMATION STATEMENTS (VISS) INTO NON-ENGLISH LANGUAGES; DEVELOPING TRAINING FOR COALITIONS AND PROVIDING THEM WITH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE; AND PROVIDING RAPID RESPONSE COMMUNICATIONS IN THE FACE OF OUTBREAKS, EMERGENCIES, AND TRENDING PRIORITIES.ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY: IAC IS ONE OF THE MOST RESPECTED AND RELIED UPON SOURCES OF UNIQUE IMMUNIZATION EDUCATIONAL TOOLS THAT IMPACT THE EDUCATION, ATTITUDES, AND PRACTICES OF HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES. IAC IS ALSO A DIRECT SOURCE OF IMMUNIZA TION INFORMATION FOR THE PUBLIC. IAC'S TWO MAJOR WEBSITES RECEIVE MORE THAN 35,000 VISITS PER DAY, PROVIDING MORE THAN 300 CONSISTENTLY UP-TO-DATE EDUCATIONAL HANDOUTS ALONG WITH FEDERALLY MANDATED VISS IN MULTIPLE LANGUAGES, ALL AVAILABLE COPYRIGHT-FREE. IAC?S EMAIL NEWS SERVICE, IAC EXPRESS, STARTED IN 1997, BROADCASTS WEEKLY IMMUNIZATION INFORMATION AND SPECIAL EDITIONS TO MORE THAN 52,000 OPT-IN SUBSCRIBERS.  THE IMMUNIZATION ACTION COALITION SERVES AS AN INDEPENDENT COMMUNICATIONS HUB THROUGH ITS WEBSITES, EMAIL NEWS SERVICES, LISTSERVS, CONFERENCE ORGANIZING AND PARTICIPATION, CONTRIBUTIONS TO POLICYMAKING, AND DIRECT CONTACT WITH EVERY VACCINE-INVOLVED FEDERAL AGENCY, STATE HEALTH DEPARTMENT, AND PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL ASSOCIATION, ALONG WITH MORE THAN 100 STATE AND LOCAL IMMUNIZATION COALITIONS. THESE CLOSE RELATIONSHIPS PROVIDE IAC WITH UNMATCHED ACCESS TO IMMUNIZATION EXPERTISE AS WELL AS TO DISTRIBUTION NETWORKS FOR ITS MATERIALS.METHODS: DURING THE FIVE-YEAR COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT, IAC PROPOSES (1) TO CREATE NEW MATERIALS AND UPDATE EXISTING MATERIALS FOR DISSEMINATION IN RESPONSE TO PUBLICATION OF NEW IMMUNIZATION RECOMMENDATIONS IN MMWR; (2) TO SEND WEEKLY EDITIONS OF IAC EXPRESS TO ITS EMAIL SUBSCRIBER BASE, IN ADDITION TO SPECIAL EDITIONS CALLED "ASK THE EXPERTS" IN WHICH IAC EXPERTS ANSWER TECHNICAL VACCINATION QUESTIONS; (3) TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO IMMUNIZATION COALITIONS THROUGH REGULAR CONFERENCE CALLS, A DEDICATED LISTSERV, AND EDUCATIONAL WEBINARS; AND (4) TO DISSEMINATE RAPID COMMUNICATIONS THROUGH IAC EXPRESS, THE IMMUNIZE.ORG WEBSITE, AND THE COALITION LISTSERV IN RESPONSE TO OUTBREAKS, EMERGENCIES, OR TRENDING PRIORITIES.

CDC-RFA-IP19-1901 IMMUNIZATION AND VACCINES FOR CHILDREN - THE FEDERATED STATES OF MICRONESIA (FSM) IS ONE OF THE SIX US AFFILIATED ISLAND JURISDICTIONS IN THE PACIFIC REGION, CONSISTING OF FOUR ISLAND GROUPS THAT ARE REFERRED TO AS THE FOUR STATES OF THE FSM. ISLAND GROUPS ARE CHUUK, POHNPEI, KOSRAE AND YAP; EACH STATE WITH THEIR OWN UNIQUE SETTINGS WHICH INCLUDES OUTLYING NEIGHBORING ISLANDS THAT ARE ONLY ACCESSIBLE BY SHIPS AND MOST WITH LIMITED OR NO CONNECTIVITY AT ALL. FSM IS ONE OF THE JURISDICTIONS THAT HAVE THE PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR CARRYING OUT THE PUBLIC HEALTH ASSURANCE FUNCTIONS REQUIRED TO ACHIEVE THE DESIRED OUTCOMES AND PERFORMANCE GOALS ESTABLISHED BY CDC.THE FSM NIP IS TRANSMITTING ITS APPLICATION TO SEEK FUNDING ASSISTANCE FROM US CENTER FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC) IMMUNIZATION AND VACCINE FOR CHILDREN FUNDS TO HELP CONTINUE ITS EFFORTS TO PLAN, DEVELOP, IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN ITS PUBLIC HEALTH INFRASTRUCTURE TO HELP ASSURE HIGH IMMUNIZATION COVERAGE LEVELS AND LOW INCIDENCE OF VACCINE PREVENTABLE DISEASES, BY INCREASING ITS PROGRAM ACTIVITIES TO REACH ALL CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND ADULT WITHIN THE NATION.GOAL: TO ACHIEVE AND SUSTAIN HIGH IMMUNIZATION COVERAGE, REDUCE VACCINATION DISPARITIES AND INCIDENTS OF VACCINE PREVENTABLE DISEASE, IMPROVE READINESS TO RESPOND TO VACCINE PREVENTABLE DISEASE THREATS, AND IMPLEMENT, DEVELOP, AND/OR ENHANCE THE FSM IMMUNIZATION INFORMATION SYSTEMS (IIS) TO SUPPORT PUBLIC HEALTH OBJECTIVES.THE OBJECTIVE: REDUCE, ELIMINATE, OR MAINTAIN ELIMINATION OF CASES OF VACCINE-PREVENTABLE DISEASES; ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN EFFECTIVE VACCINATION COVERAGE LEVELS FOR UNIVERSALLY RECOMMENDED VACCINES AMONG YOUNG CHILDREN; THE FSM NIP ALONG WITH STATE PROGRAMS WILL IMPLEMENT ALL THE ACTIVITIES DEVELOPED UNDER THE IPOM 2019-2023 CHAPTERS.ACTIVITY: IMPLEMENT ALL DEVELOPED SMART ACTIVITIES AND PERFORMANCE MEASURES THAT LINK TO NEW IPOM 2019 -2023 ON THE 12 CHAPTERS. THE FSM NIP WILL SUPPORT THE STATE PROGRAMS IN IMPLEMENTATION, MONITORING, ASSESSMENT, TRAI NINGS AND REPORTING OF SMART ACTIVITIES TO TRACK PROGRESS TOWARD THE IDENTIFIED MEASURES.EVALUATION: FSM NIP AND STATE PROGRAMS WILL PARTICIPATE IN PROGRAM TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE SITE VISITS/VIRTUAL TECHNICAL SUPPORT, CDC-LED INITIATIVE TO ASSESS AND MONITOR ACTIVITIES, AND SUBMIT MID-YEAR PROGRESS REPORTS AND END OF YEAR/ANNUAL REPORTS. THE STATE PROGRAMS ARE TO SUBMIT ANNUAL WORK PLANS, MONTHLY WORK PLAN REPORTS, INVENTORY REPORTS AND REQUESTS, HEPATITIS B MONTHLY REPORT, AND UPDATE NIP DURING COORDINATORS AND PROGRAM ANNUAL MEETINGS.KEY TERMS: FSM NIP ALONG WITH STATE PROGRAMS WILL CARRY OUT THE PUBLIC HEALTH ASSURANCE FUNCTIONS TO ACHIEVE AND SUSTAIN HIGH IMMUNIZATION COVERAGE, REDUCE VACCINATION DISPARITIES AND INCIDENTS OF VACCINE PREVENTABLE DISEASE, AND IMPROVE READINESS TO RESPOND TO VACCINE PREVENTABLE DISEASE THREATS IN THE NATION.

IMMUNIZATION PROGRAM COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FOR PALAU MINISTRY OF HEALTH, BUREAU OF PUBLIC HEALTH - IIS SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING IMMUNIZATION INFORMATION SYSTEMS (IISS) ARE CONFIDENTIAL, POPULATION-BASED COMPUTERIZED DATABASES THAT RECORD ALL VACCINE DOSES ADMINISTERED BY PARTICIPATING PROVIDERS TO PERSONS RESIDING WITHIN A GIVEN GEOGRAPHIC AREA. AT THE POINT OF CLINICAL CARE, AN IIS CAN PROVIDE CONSOLIDATED PATIENT IMMUNIZATION HISTORIES FOR THE PROVIDER TO USE IN DETERMINING APPROPRIATE VACCINATIONS. AT THE POPULATION LEVEL, AN IIS PROVIDES AGGREGATE DATA ON VACCINATIONS TO: " GUIDE PUBLIC HEALTH ACTIONS SUCH AS PRIORITIZATION WITHIN POPULATION SUBGROUPS WITH LOW VACCINATION RATES. " IDENTIFY PROVIDERS WITH LOW IMMUNIZATION COVERAGE. " MONITOR IMMUNIZATION RATES OVER TIME TO IDENTIFY TRENDS AND AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT. " ENSURE ONGOING PROGRAM QUALITY IMPROVEMENT. " SUPPORT ROUTINE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VACCINE INVENTORY AND ORDERING. " SUPPORT EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS ACTIVITIES.
